fields.fieldDescription: The Record ID (RID) that uniquely identifies a General Ledger entry.
The code for the accounting operation associated with the General Ledger entry.
The amount of the General Ledger entry.
The code for the branch associated with the General Ledger entry.
The code for the business transaction associated with the General Ledger entry.
Indicates whether or not the associated General Ledger entry is negative.
The code for the currency associated with the General Ledger entry.
The Record ID (RID) for the deal associated with the General Ledger entry.
The expense code associated with the General Ledger entry.
The Record ID (RID) for the facility associated with the General Ledger entry.
The code for the General Ledger account associated with the General Ledger entry.
The code for the General Ledger short name associated with the General Ledger entry.

Indicates whether this journal entry was created due to a cashflow between two host entities which was necessitated by the fact that an external customer's cashflow with one host entity used a payment method which was with a different host entity.
The unique ID of the journal to which this journal entry will be posted.
The code for the processing area associated with the General Ledger entry.
The Record ID (RID) for the customer service group associated with the General Ledger entry.
The Record ID (RID) for the owner of the General Ledger entry (if applicable).
The code describing the type of owner (if applicable).
"The value date, or effective date as of which the entry was posted to the General Ledger."
Timestamp from when this row was created.
Timestamp from when this row was last updated.
User ID that created this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
User ID that last updated this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
"The business date on which the G/L entry was created, based on the branch of the transaction for which the G/L entry was created."

"True indicates that this G/L entry is associated with a receivable or payable offset account (used when a transaction is released and a cashflow is not ""done"" (i.e. expected cash is not sent or received))."
The entity code for the entity associated with this General Ledger entry.

"If outstanding related, contains the ID of the associated outstanding.  If facility related, contains the facility control number.  If neither outstanding nor facility related, contains the ID of the associated deal."
The deal tracking number of the associated deal.

The sequence number that will be generated and filled in by the batch and concatenated with the business transaction code and Owner ID to create a unique ID for the G/L entry.  (The on-line will set it to blank.)

The status of this G/L Entry on the queue for posting to the General Ledger.  The on-line will set this to Pending and the interface program will change it to posted when it posts it to the General Ledger.
The aggregation amount.
Indicates whether or not this transaction represents a reversal of a prior transaction.
The Record ID (RID) for the customer associated with the General Ledger entry.
"The business date on which the G/L entry was created, based on the branch of the transaction for which the G/L entry was created."
The type code of the security associated with the G/L entry.
The month of the value date (effective date as of which the entry was posted to the General Ledger).
Indicates whether this is a summarization of archived entries
Indicates whether the entry is a contingent accounting entry.
The date the entry was posted to the General Ledger.
Indicates whether or not the General Ledger entry is subject to accrual.
The Record ID (RID) that uniquely identifies the cashflow associated with the General Ledger entry (if applicable).
The Record ID (RID) that uniquely identifies the matchfunded cashflow associated with the General Ledger entry (if applicable).
The code for the country associated with the General Ledger entry.
The Master Customer Number.  Identifies a customer at a specific location.
Indicates whether or not the Profit/Loss is to be deferred.
The code for the fee type (if applicable).
The Record ID (RID) for the fee (if applicable).
The code for the General Ledger class associated with the G/L entry.
The Record ID (RID) for the outstanding associated with the General Ledger entry (if applicable).
The code for the payment method associated with the General Ledger entry.
The code for the portfolio associated with the General Ledger entry.
The code for the source object.
The Record ID (RID) for the Work In Process item associated with the General Ledger entry.
The percentage representing the matchfunded cost of funds rate.
The textual description of the General Ledger entry
Gle Rid Orig Tran
Gla Cde Essnc Stus
